memberdef.argsstring: (HostToDevice, InIter begin, InIter end, OutIter result) noexcept
memberdef.name: copy

briefdescription.para: A host-to-device copy routine. Note this is just a wrapper around memcpy, so it assumes contiguous storage. The amrex-provided containers like Gpu::HostVector, Gpu::DeviceVector, etc. meet this requirement.

detaileddescription.para: This version is blocking - CPU execution will halt until the copy is finished.

InIter
The input iterator type
OutIter
The output iterator type
begin
Where in the input to start reading
end
Where in the input to stop reading
result
Where in the output to start writing
Example usage: Gpu::copy(Gpu::hostToDevice,a.begin(),a.end(),b.begin());

memberdef.argsstring: (DeviceToHost, InIter begin, InIter end, OutIter result) noexcept
memberdef.name: copy

briefdescription.para: A device-to-host copy routine. Note this is just a wrapper around memcpy, so it assumes contiguous storage. The amrex-provided containers like Gpu::HostVector, Gpu::DeviceVector, etc. meet this requirement.

detaileddescription.para: This version is blocking - CPU execution will halt until the copy is finished.

InIter
The input iterator type
OutIter
The output iterator type
begin
Where in the input to start reading
end
Where in the input to stop reading
result
Where in the output to start writing
Example usage: Gpu::copy(Gpu::deviceToHost,a.begin(),a.end(),b.begin());

memberdef.name: copy

briefdescription.para: A device-to-device copy routine. Note this is just a wrapper around memcpy, so it assumes contiguous storage. The amrex-provided containers like Gpu::HostVector, Gpu::DeviceVector, etc. meet this requirement.

detaileddescription.para: This version is blocking - CPU execution will halt until the copy is finished.

InIter
The input iterator type
OutIter
The output iterator type
begin
Where in the input to start reading
end
Where in the input to stop reading
result
Where in the output to start writing
Example usage: Gpu::copy(Gpu::deviceToDevice,a.begin(),a.end(),b.begin());

memberdef.name: copyAsync

briefdescription.para: A host-to-device copy routine. Note this is just a wrapper around memcpy, so it assumes contiguous storage. The amrex-provided containers like Gpu::HostVector, Gpu::DeviceVector, etc. meet this requirement.

detaileddescription.para: This version is asynchronous - CPU execution will continue, whether or not the copy is finished.

InIter
The input iterator type
OutIter
The output iterator type
begin
Where in the input to start reading
end
Where in the input to stop reading
result
Where in the output to start writing
Example usage: Gpu::copyAsync(Gpu::hostToDevice,a.begin(),a.end(),b.begin());

memberdef.argsstring: (DeviceToHost, InIter begin, InIter end, OutIter result) noexcept
memberdef.name: copyAsync

briefdescription.para: A device-to-host copy routine. Note this is just a wrapper around memcpy, so it assumes contiguous storage. The amrex-provided containers like Gpu::HostVector, Gpu::DeviceVector, etc. meet this requirement.

detaileddescription.para: This version is asynchronous - CPU execution will continue, whether or not the copy is finished.

InIter
The input iterator type
OutIter
The output iterator type
begin
Where in the input to start reading
end
Where in the input to stop reading
result
Where in the output to start writing
Example usage: Gpu::copyAsync(Gpu::deviceToHost,a.begin(),a.end(),b.begin());

memberdef.argsstring: (DeviceToDevice, InIter begin, InIter end, OutIter result) noexcept
memberdef.name: copyAsync

briefdescription.para: A device-to-device copy routine. Note this is just a wrapper around memcpy, so it assumes contiguous storage. The amrex-provided containers like Gpu::HostVector, Gpu::DeviceVector, etc. meet this requirement.

detaileddescription.para: This version is asynchronous - CPU execution will continue, whether or not the copy is finished.

InIter
The input iterator type
OutIter
The output iterator type
begin
Where in the input to start reading
end
Where in the input to stop reading
result
Where in the output to start writing
Example usage: Gpu::copyAsync(Gpu::deviceToDevice,a.begin(),a.end(),b.begin());

briefdescription.para: Migrate elements of a container from device to host. This is a no-op for host-only code.

detaileddescription.para: This version is blocking - CPU execution will halt until the migration is finished.

briefdescription.para: Migrate elements of a container from host to device. This is a no-op for host-only code.

detaileddescription.para: This version is blocking - CPU execution will halt until the migration is finished.

param.type: std::enable_if_t<(sizeof(T)<=36 *8) &&std::is_trivially_copyable_v< T > &&amrex::IsCallable< F, T &, Long >::value, int >

memberdef.argsstring: (IT first, IT last, F const &f) noexcept
memberdef.name: fillAsync

briefdescription.para: Fill the elements in the given range using the given calllable.

detaileddescription.para: This function is asynchronous for GPU builds.

parameterdescription.para: the inclusive first in the range [first, last)
the exclusive last in the range [first, last)
the callable with the function signature of void(T&, Long), where T is the element type and the Long parameter is the index for the element to be filled.

detaileddescription.para: Enable/disable GPU kernel launches.

simplesect.para: This will only switch from GPU to CPU for kernels launched with macros. Functions like amrex::ParallelFor will be unaffected. Therefore it should not be used for comparing GPU to non-GPU performance or behavior.

detaileddescription.para: Will disable the launching of GPU kernels between the calls.

Deallocate memory belonging to an arena asynchronously. Memory deallocated in this way is held in a pool and will not be reused until the next amrex::Gpu::streamSynchronize(). GPU kernels that were already launched on the currently active stream can still continue to use the memory after this function is called. There is no need to use this function for CPU-only memory or withThe_Async_Arena.

parameterdescription.para: the arena the memory belongs to
pointer to the memory to be freed

detaileddescription.para: Clear the temporary buffer used by freeAsync. This is done by synchronizing the stream in case there is memory in the buffer. Returns true if some memory could be freed.
